JobTitle: Strategic Operations Manager, Courier Engagement (Uber Eats)
JobFullDesc: About the Role  Uber Eats is revolutionizing instant delivery and making dining effortless: from eating locally, to ordering groceries, to celebrating with a bottle of wine. The options are endless. Working at Eats means delivering on all possibilities, not just for customers, but for merchants trying to grow their business and for delivery people searching for earnings opportunities. The Strategic Operations team is scaling the most impactful projects across US and Canada. The team's unique focus on the entire region allows us to dream big and drive outsized change in the areas of marketplace dynamics, automation, sales operations, and strategy. Within Strategic Operations our Courier Operations team is focused on optimizing courier growth, experience, and engagement to help connect merchants and consumers, and provide independent and flexible earning opportunities.  What You'll DoProactively scope and lead multiple projects to help grow our courier pipeline and base; take accountability for project outcomes, ensure delivery on project critical metrics, & keep others informed of progressAnalyze sophisticated data, build models, and aggregate insights to drive key business decisions and policiesDefine critical metrics and develop dashboards to track business performance; report findings to senior leadership to define long-term strategy and decision-makingCollaborate and work cross-functionally with other operations teams as well as Product, Sales, Marketing, Finance, etc. to ensure insights inform broader critical initiativesBuild a cohesive strategy for programs and solutions to build for our end-to-end ecosystem Basic QualificationsAt least 2+ year of professional experience in Operations Management or Strategy Preferred Qualifications3-4 years of experience in strategy, operations, or related fieldSelf-starter with an analytical orientation; compassionate and leans in and embraces rolling up your sleeves with your team; skilled at balancing between short-term needs and long-term investments; flourishes with change and comfortable with ambiguityBias toward action and constant push for clarity and executionExcellent written and verbal communication skills as well as partner management, consensus building, and project managementExceptional Excel / data management skillsSQL proficiency strongly preferredBachelor's degree (preferably in business, economics, math, or other related field)
